node.html:
• Hackcouver is Vancouver's first hackathon for high schoolers
  • Designed their website and managed their automated mailing system
  • Despite the hackathon's cancellation due to COVID-19, we still ran a workshop to keep the interest of our registrants
  • I ran the workshop, titled "Intro to AI in Python", which had 70 registrants

• Millennium STEM is an organization dedicated to empowering youths in STEM
  • Assisted with runnin several webinars introducing high schoolers to STEM career and post-secondary oppurtunities
  • Also assited with fundraisers

• The Churchill Code Club is a school club that prepares students for the Canadian Computing Competition
  • The club was seperated into beginners and advanced students based on experience, and I was the advanced group's instructor
  • I spent about an hour a week planning each lesson and another hour at lunch teaching it
  • My lessons can be found at https://github.com/kevinlu1248/ccc_python_lessons

• Math Challengers is an annual competition hosted by UBC or SFU for grades 8-10 every spring
  • As I noticed that in past years, the team is mostly managed by teachers who are often busy, I decided to become the coach
  • I spent a lunch hour every week for practices and selected the teams based on aptitute tests I planned
  • Over two years, our teams have been awarded with three trophies (top 3 team overall) and 5 medals, one of which is a second place!
